citeinfo.origin: Minnesota Department of Transportation, Office of Land Management
citeinfo.title: Railroad Station Plat Map - Point Locations, Minnesota

descript.abstract: Point shapefile provides the location and subsequent link to images of railroad station plats. Data contains information about the railroad ownership, roll numbers, sheet numbers and file names of the images.
descript.purpose: The data set was created to improve accessibility to the railroad station plat map images. The point locations are used within a spatial index to simplify the finding, viewing, and downloading of railroad station plat map images. This data set does not include images of the railroad station plats.

timeperd.current: The time period of the image content ranges between 1918 and 1974. The Minnesota Department of Transportation received the maps from the Railroad and Warehouse Commission in 1974. The conversion of the railroad plat maps from paper to electronic form and the work required to create a corresponding data point by digitizing each plat location were completed in 2004.

theme.themekey: Transportation, Location, Station Plat Images, Right of Way maps, Railroads, Railroad Station Plat Map, Railroad Junctions

citeinfo.title: Railroad coverage including abandoned lines, Railroad Station Plat images, Railroad Valuation images, State basemap (active railroad lines), 1936 County Map Series with Government Lots, Sections, Townships and Ranges, Minnesota Railroad and Warehouse Commission Historical Railroad Maps.

cntperp.cntorg: MN Department of Transportation, Office of Land Management

attracc.attraccr: An extensive quality assurance/quality control process was applied to assure that the correct attributes were linked to the correct point and that the attribute naming was correct.

dataqual.complete: Each railroad station plat map in the collection was scanned and for each image the location of the station was digitized and attributes were assigned.

horizpa.horizpar: The shapefile accurately represents the center points of the station plat images however, the image centerline, although generally accurate to within 15 meters, may be as much as 60 meters off from the data point in some areas.

procstep.procdesc: The point shapefile was created under contract with St. Cloud State University, Spatial Analysis Center. Each point was labeled with the name of the corresponding image it represents. For this project all the station plats in the collection were scanned. The maps have the following data relative to the railroad Right of Way: land lines (e.g. section lines, quarter lines and sixteenth lines), centerline alignment including curve data used to define the Right of Way, land ties (e.g. distances and angles between the centerline and land lines) and the Right of Way width. Some of MnDOT's station plat maps can be considered 'Track Maps'. While few in number and total track coverage in Minnesota, these Track Maps show the layout and detail of track structures, especially where there are multiple tracks.

overview.eaover: OBJECTID = data system file number, point identifier ROLL_NUM = The roll number of the map. SHEET_NUM = The sheet number. Map rolls can be split into many sheets. IMAGE_NAME = The image filename with file extension STAT_NAME = The Station Plat Name. RR_NAME = The Railroad Name. RR_ABBR = Railroad abbreviation. GEOR_REF = The system file pathname. CNTYFD_NUM = The MnDOT county number. CNTYFD_STR = The MnDOT county number in string format CNYT_NAME = The county name. SHAPE= SE_ANNO_CAD_DATA=

stdorder.ordering:
Download the point shapefile via the Minnesota Geospatial Commons (click "I AGREE" in the Online Linkage field below). The shapefile transfer size is 888 KB.
All Railroad Map image files can be downloaded directly from RIGHT OF WAY MAPPING and MONITORING or ELECTRONIC DOCUMENT ACCESS. See this CHART for a comparison between these delivery sites. For other information or assistance complete the on-line request FORM by including your contact information and telephone number or send the same information to lisrwmap.dot@state.mn.us
RIGHT OF WAY MAPPING and MONITORING - http://www.dot.state.mn.us/maps/gisweb/row/ ELECTRONIC DOCUMENT ACCESS - Currently available only when using Internet Explorer. http://dotapp7.dot.state.mn.us/cyberdocs_guest/Libraries/Default_Library/Groups/GUESTS/frameset.asp
CHART - http://gisservices.dot.state.mn.us/mndot-rwmm/Right%20of%20Way%20Mapping.docx FORM - http://olmwebservices.dot.state.mn.us/maprequest/requestmain.aspx
